resources.string: Welcome To Bhandara Area\n Tour Guide!

Cuisine: Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian 

 Apple Restaurant is situated beside National Highway No. 6, at Lakhani. It is near about 13 miles away from Bhandara, Maharashtra.

 It is multi cuisine restaurant with varieties of Indian Food, as well as Chinese food.

 It is cheap in price, but it has good quality food.
Working Days : Everyday\t 11.00 AM to 11.00 PM.

Cuisine: Vegetarian 

 Ranat Bhavar is situated beside N.H.06 in Bhandara. It is famous Vegetarian Restaurant for indian food in bhandara.

 It has good service, in affordable price.
Working Days: Everyday\t 09.00 AM to 09.00 PM.

Cuisine: Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian 

 Address: At Sakoli, Dist- Bhandara, Maharashtra Tuli Suit is a Resort and situated at Sakoli lake in Sakoli. 

 Nagzira National Tiger Reserve is just 13 miles away from Tuli Suit.

 It has good service, but it expensive in price.

 Amenities:
 Pool, Kids and Family Friendly, Restaurant, Bar/Lounge, Spa, Breakfast.

Cuisine: Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian

 Address: Bhandara, National Highway No 6, Near Honda Showroom, Sainath Nagar, Teachers Colony, Ashrafi Nagar, Bhandara, Maharashtra 441906

 Website: http://www.omsroyalplaza.com

Cuisine: Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian

 Kamboj Foods, a multi cuisine family restaurant opened in Bhandara city, with crisp modern design, edgy lighting, experienced staff and the tasty food

 Address: Address: Vidarbha Housing Board Colony, MSEB Colony, Bhandara, Maharashtra 441904

Cuisine: Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian

 Stop Inn Family Restaurant in Sakoli.A multi cuisine family restaurant synonymous with delicious food that can satiate all food cravings.

 Nagzira National Tiger Reserve is just 13 miles away from STOP INN.

 Address: National Highway No. 6, Sakoli, Maharashtra 441802
It is old part of Bhandara city which is famous for shopping.\n It is nearly a mile long road placed with various shops in both sides.
It is a best shop for providing various types of handlooms in bhandara city.\n Address: Ram Madir Ward, Santaji Nagar, Bhandara, Maharashtra 441904.
Sindhi Lane is old part of Lakhani city which is famous for shopping.\n\n Address : At Lakhani, Maharashtra 441804.

This medieval period fort is situated in Tumsar taluka in Bhandara and about 8 miles away from tumsarand 33 miles away from Bhandara district.

 Fort was constructed by Raja Khan Pathan, the subhedar of Bakht buland shah, the ruler of Devgadh around 1700 A.D.

 Later it came under possession of Raja Raghuji Bhosle of Nagpur who used as prison for captives. Later on it had taken over by British.
This bridge is developed over wainganga river which is the main source water and fish production in Bhandara District. This bridge was developed by British and presently it is opened.

It is a grand structure that has been a landmark for over 150 years in Bhadara city.

 Pandey Mahal, built by Raibahadur Yadaorao Pandey, was considered to be an architectural marvel.

 However, Descendants of Pandey have now sold two main portions of the palace, and the buyers have begun to demolish it.

The Sangadi Fort is Located at Sakoli Tehsil.
 The fort currently lies in ruins erected by the Divan family of Seoni, which held the two zamindari estates of Gewardha in Chanda and Rajoli in Bhandara.

 The fort was called Sahangad or the fort of Sahan, the word meaning the court or small enclosure at the back of a house.
 It is said that the village was so named because it lay right at the extremity of the parganas to the south-east.

Andhalgaon also known as Andhalgaon or the dark village, is a village of 5,164 inhabitants in 1971 in Bhandara tahsil lying about 16 miles north of Bhandara and connected with Mohali by a good metalled road.

 It is one of the principal centers in the district having a considerable weaving industry, silk bordered cloths for women being chiefly produced. 

 The kosa (silk) cloth for which the district is so well-known has become very costly and hence the demand for it has correspondingly declined.

 A weekly marked is held on Wednesdays to which some cattle are also brought for sale.
 Andhalgaon has a primary, an allopathic dispensary, a maternity home, a veterinary aid center, a sarvodaya center, and a library.
 There are also a sub-post office and a police outpost.

Gaimukh, one of the small villages, is located in the Bhandara tehsil.
 The village received its name from the rock that resembles a cowâ€™s mouth and brings water to the village through a spring,which flows down from Ambagar.

 Renowned for housing a shrine, the village is frequently visited by pilgrims and tourists for viewing a cave temple, which portrays the presence of Kuramvars at the site.

Indirasagar dam is an earthfill dam on the Wainganga River near Pauni taluka in Bhandara district in state of Maharashtra in India.

 The dam consists of 33 Nos of spillway gates to regulate irrigation water into the river through out the year.

 This dam is also known as Gose Khurd Dam because it is situated near Gose village.

This place is famous for a more than hundred year old Temple dedicated to Rama constructed by Shri Sitaram Prasad Dube a resident of Gunthara village on a hillock.

 On Ekadashi Amawasya day of kartik month from hindu calendar, religious gathering takes place here.

 On the both sides of the tank there is dense forest which has converted it into not only a tourist and picnic spot but also a bird sanctuary.

Koka is about 30 km from Bhandara which is covered with dense forest.
 The trees in this forest are of the age of 100 years.

 Koka is a bird sactuary. Here the lake is famous for Siberian migrant birds. These birds come in the month of December and return in mid of January.

Nagzira wildlife sanctuary is located between Bhandara district and Gondia district of Maharashtra.

 Nagzira Wildlife Sanctuary is locked in the arms of nature and adorned with a picturesque landscape, luxuriant vegetation and serves as a living outdoor museum to explore and appreciate nature.

 Nagzira national park is category second national park by IUCN(International Union for Conservation of Nature).
Safari: 06.00 AM \tto\t 10.30 AM and 03.30 PM \tto\t 06.30 PM
